Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Value for the Money, If You Don't Mind the Little Quirks”
Reviews.Author: PilotMike2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Star Express in March 2012 and paid about US$80 a night. The hotel is 30 minutes by taxi from the international airport serving Istanbul. Overall, this is a small, neighborhood hotel just off the lively Taksim Square in downtown Istanbul. It is NOT a business hotel, so under normal circumstances I would not recommend this facility. But itâ€™s quirky and cute, and after a while it suddenly feels like home. The first problem you will have is getting here. There are several Star Hotels in the area, and taxis will take you to all the better-known and wrong ones. Hereâ€™s the best way to do this: Step 1: Tell the taxi to take you to the Marmara Hotel, Taksim Square. Everybody will know it. (Itâ€™s also the nearest Starbucks.) Step 2: The traffic in Taksim Square flows only one-way, so the Marmara Hotel will come up on your right. Go past the Marmara Hotel two small streets, probably not more than 75 meters, past the Bank on your right. At that second street, turn right. Step 3: Go 150 meters down the hill and look for Star Express Hotel to be on your right, behind a small park. Take the right-hand turn down a very steep, spiraling road to the front door of the hotel. Whew! Youâ€™re there. (Alternatively, if you are not heavily burdened with luggage, simply get out of the taxi at the Marmara Hotel and walk 100 meters down the side street immediately adjacent to the Marmara; itâ€™s easy.) Now that youâ€™re here, what will you find? A very cordial and welcoming staff, although English will not be their strongest skill. But they will check you in briskly, whisk you up to your room, show you the view of the park and be smiling the entire time. Please note: there is NO handicap access to this hotel; if you canâ€™t climb stairs, you canâ€™t get in. The Star Express Hotel is a world of small. There only are four rooms on each floor, and there are only seven floors, so itâ€™s never crowded or noisy. The lobby is small; my head almost touches the ceiling at one spot. The elevator is smaller than an old British phone booth; it holds three people in a pinch, barely. But, if you are lucky like me, you will be jammed into the elevator with a Turkish beauty with a lovely smile, and you wonâ€™t mind one bit! The breakfast room also is small â€“ 12 tables perhaps? â€“ and the breakfast buffet is small but sufficient. (Olives for breakfast? It works!) Oddly, there is a flat-screen TV in the breakfast bar that shows Turkish music videos 24-hours a day; all of the staff is watching it and practicing their dance moves, so donâ€™t even think of switching it to the BBC to find out whatâ€™s going on in the world. The rooms continue this Disneyesque them of a small, small world. The rooms are cozy. The TV is tiny, and the desk where I am writing this is the smallest piece of furniture I have ever used. The A/C doesnâ€™t kick in until the temperature rises above 25Â°C, so I opened the window and listened to the burbles of the city. (My room faced on to the park at the front of the hotel.) The bed was comfy and the bathroom towels were arrayed on each bed in a very attractive manner, so clearly their staff is looking to do the best they can with what they have. The bathroom is a bit of a problem. It is functional but tiny; you need to close the door to use the toilet. My shoulders are as wide as the shower (no bath tub in my room), and I kept bumping the handle for the hot water with my backside, making the water run cold. There was some mold in the shower and a glass shelf over the sink upon which I bumped my head every time I brushed my teeth. Hey, for $80 in one of the worldâ€™s greatest cities, youâ€™re not going to get the Ritz. Another minor problem was recharging my laptop. Electricity is a bit scarce in these older buildings, so I had to unplug the mini-bar between the beds to find a plug for my computer. To keep the email running, I slept with the power cord running from the mini-bar going under my pillow and on to the laptop on the desk (see photo). The wireless is free, reasonably fast and easy to log-in. That being said, it all works just fine. Just donâ€™t plan on having a meeting in your room, or a party. You simply wonâ€™t fit. One final important point: just off Taksim Square is a massive shopping and restaurant district; itâ€™s the broad, bright and car-less Istikial Avenue. Itâ€™s a wide, steeply-sloped boulevard that extends from Taksim Square downhill past the Galata Tower right to the waterfront on the Golden Horn. Thereâ€™s a cute tram that trundles up and down the Avenue, with people jumping on and off (see photo). On most afternoons and nights the Avenue is full of families, friends and lovers. Itâ€™s clean, bright and delightful, and an easy walk from the Star Express. Donâ€™t miss it. Overall, I think the Star Express is a charming, quirky and affordable hotel in a great location and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ilgins
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Clean rooms. Great location (2 mins walking distance to Taksim square).

Reviews.Title: “shahram”
Reviews.Author: SHAHRAM S
Reviews.Content: location iis very nice and the room is clean but it's smal and breakfast is poorthe hotel staff was Being irritable and angry .

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: tamerlan_8
Reviews.Content: The locations is perfect, very near from Taksim (3 min. walking), and in a very quiet street. I booked through booking.com, and I payed for a room 50 euros for two people. The room was good, not very big, but clean, new, and with good views from the last floor. I find it cute, and knowing how are the prices in taksim area is a really good value for your money. I will reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise considering some of the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Mal661
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed in this hotel from 29 sept 2011 to 3 oct 2011. Having read some of the reviews we were a bit nervous about our decision to book the hotel. On arrival we were pleasantly surprised with the hotel (despite the scaffolding outside for a paint job). The reception staff were friendly and efficient and had good English. The room we stayed in was 204 and it was immaculately clean and nicely decorated which gave it a mice ambience. The beds were like soft clouds and just seemed to wrap around you, we got some great sleeps while there. Despite some reviewers complaining about the breakfasts, we found the breakfast to be excellent and there was always plenty to go around and the plates were always refilled. The hotel itself while small is very comfortable and clean and close to all amenities, trams etc. A walk up or down the hill will take you onto the transport system. I would stay in this hotel again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Star On Taksim Square”
Reviews.Author: AZIZ N
Reviews.Content: spent 5 beautiful days in istanbul in sep 2011. it was a very gd stay. i stayed in the bhosphorous view facing room on the 6th floor,601, it was the best room in Taksim Star. room was gd and neat. Breakfast was quite average. Staff was vey helpful. Excellent location. Few steps away from the famous taksim square and istikal street. they only need to upgrade their key system and the AC. rest all was grt....

Reviews.Title: “Good enough...to visit the city”
Reviews.Author: WSalamah
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal on the price via booking.com, i liked the hotel its clean and staff are very helpful. Although I spent most of my time out of the hotel but when i come back I feel like Iâ€™m at home.

Reviews.Title: “Small but OK for a cheap price!”
Reviews.Author: Lovinthesun26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March for 5 nights. The hotel is a lot smaller then we expected, however was suitable for a short stay. We booked 2 double rooms. When we checked in we ended up with a twin room and a double. The double room was extremely small but clean, it had a Queen size bed not a full double , the bathroom was also small but clean; it was suitable for a single person but if there were 2 people staying in this room it would have been a struggle. The twin room was an average size, again the bathroom was small but clean. The rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels. Breakfast â€“ this was a basic Turkish breakfast, very limited choice, not the best quality but was edible. Location â€“ 5 minute walk to Taksim Square, however the quickest way to get to this hotel was down a dark back alley. We managed to get a cheap deal for this hotel, however the rate for this hotel has tripled, we would not be willing to pay more to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Taksim Star Express - Taksim Square”
Reviews.Author: tauzlovetotravel
Reviews.Content: Bathroom extremely moldy!! Showers are uncomfortable and mold is not only in the shower but on the bathroom tile. They leave extra toilet role on the handle of the toilet cleaner. Room is small but okay. No business center, no pool (website is a little misleading), no laundry. When we asked how much to send out for laundry, they quoted a ridiculous amount. Hard to communicate with front desk but some of the front desk folks tried to be helpful. Hotel is not ideal for first time Istanbul travelers. Front desk does not take phone message or deliver messages. Our tour company started to fax in pick up times rather than calling the hotel to let us know. Would not book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “there might be worse - but for the price u can find easily better”
Reviews.Author: Samaramaus
Reviews.Content: having toured turkey for 2 weeks, this was our last and very most disappointing hotel: apparently staff has to ask for full payment on arrival (this is the very first time that we were asked to pay at check-in); room cupboard sized; bathroon door very very difficult to close; bathroom ok, half clean, small, according to booking description: "panoramic view" - facts: half of the window was covered by another part of the building and through the other half of the window we could see neighbouring houses... staff: lack of motivation? breakfast: even if you leave early (and tell them in advance), they will surely not knock it off your bill and don't imagine it is possible to get at least a coffee; very very noisy; advantage: close to where the shuttle bus arrives from the airport ; breakfast : good variety of bad products

Reviews.Title: “Best reasonable budget accommodation in Taksim!!”
Reviews.Author: Kumaneko
Reviews.Content: If you are on a tight budget and want to stay in Taksim square, search no more!! This hotel is very close to Taksim square in a back, quiet street which comes in to handy for those who have to catch an airport limousine early in the morning or late at night. The room was kind of small but beautiful, clean and well-equipped. I spent only 1 night at the hotel during a transit from Istanbul to Cappadocia.. Since we had to leave very early for our flight to Kayseri, we didn't have breakfast which was included at the hotel though. It took only 20 minutes to Taksim square from Ataturk airport at night and took only 45 minutes from Taksim sq. to Sabiha Gokcen in the morning. The travelling time shown in Havas HP seems to take into account heavy traffic in Istanbul, so it is twice as long compared to the time needed when there is no traffic at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: arjungupta101
Reviews.Content: Location - 5mins walk to Taksim Square and Istiklal street - most happening place Rooms - very clean, all amenities, but very small. Very smartly fitted everthing in such a small room, but comfortable. No complaints Service - Good. Staff was helpful, though very eager to sell the sightseeing tours Breakfast - okish. Breakfast isnt a big meal in Turkey it seeems, so its ok. Mainly bread, jam, cheese and fruit. Can be noisy at night as is very close to a fast traffic moving road

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: tom_ashford_uk
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel, nothing fancy about this hotel but it was clean and comfortable and the staff were helpful and friendly. The location was great - close to Taksim square and Istiklal Caddesi for great nightlife with easy transport (metro/tram) for reaching virtually any part of Istanbul. Breakfast buffet was plentiful though the choice of foods was a little eclectic.

Reviews.Title: “Trully Fair Solution for Budget vacation”
Reviews.Author: Blunket_Vag
Reviews.Content: Very helpful reception desk, small but clean, comfy and quite rooms, ideal location of the hotel near popular Istiklar Ave., Taksim Sq. and all transport modes, decent breakfast. Would definately reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room @ vey good location”
Reviews.Author: jajabor_95
Reviews.Content: The location was very good and the room was clean. We were expecting a budget hotel but the room was more tiny than what we had expected for 50Euros. We had 3 suitcases and had a difficult time accomodating them in the tiny room. Breakfast was vey basic. We were looking for an adapter for our laptop plug (US 3 pin) to use with the European 2 pin inlet but were told that it'll cost us 20 Turkish Lira to get one ! We bought an adapter the next day for 1.50 Turkish Lira !

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a good location”
Reviews.Author: sweety0310
Reviews.Content: Good location (close to Taksim Metro) and reasonably priced. Small yet clean and with good internet connection (free)

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable clean hotel suitable for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: BrieEngland
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had a lovely stay here. It was a great base to shop from, close to Taksim square and easily accessible by taxi or public transport to all the major attractions. The staff were friendly and very helpful, even organising our trips for us. We look forward to returning in the future

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Wdave37
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to stay in Taksim and spend as little money as possible, yet want to avoid a hostel, this is the place to stay. The rooms are pretty small, but if you're okay with that, this is about a 7 minute walk from the hustle and bustle of Istikal Street (the busiest drag in Istanbul). The bellhop provides great service, also free wireless internet. The only real negative is that the breakfast is pretty boring, and this hotel can be very hard to find the first time.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice hotel, awesome people!!!”
Reviews.Author: zackisgreat
Reviews.Content: my mother, father and I stayed at this hotel for a month and had a great experience! the hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. the hotel is in a great location with st. sofia and blue mosk very close walking distance and lots of nice shops and restaurants in the area. the desk clerk and owner were very friendly and provided great info on the area and the cost was the best in the area for the quality. we had a kitchen in our room and a balcony overlooking the ocean. we are planning a trip and will stay again at the star hotel next year. say hello to payam for me and dont forget to tip!!! http://www.starhotelistanbul.com/

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: Dancome
Reviews.Content: Good location, insultan ahmet, rooms basic but clean, tour office just next door with compettive prices. Hotel price was ok for what you got and the staff were helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Taksim Star Express Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Ismet Inonu Caddesi-Dunya Saglik Sk No 11-13 | Taksim, Istanbul 34437, Turkey
